snippet: The minor bowl games may not have an effect on a college tournament that the N.C.A.A. should institute, but they have value in ways that have nothing to do with football.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column reconsiders his position that minor bowl games are irrelevant, but asserts that college football still needs a playoff system to determine the national championship.
lead_paragraph: The minor bowl games may not have an effect on a college tournament that the N.C.A.A. should institute, but they have value in ways that have nothing to do with football.

headline.seo: Football Playoff Is a Necessity, but Bowl Games Have Their Place
headline.main: Bring on a Playoff, but Save the Bowl System
headline.print_headline: Bring on a Playoff, but Save the Bowl System
